page.title: 06The Village Nurse.
page.content: Years ago the church or nuns helped the poor in need.When Queen Victoria celebrated her Golden Jubilee in 1887, all the women of Great Britain gave one shilling(5p) as a gift to the Queen.She was asked what she would like done with all the money.She decided to form an association to train nurses.This helped the elderly and the poor.This is how district nursing started. Nurse Moffat has been the nurse in Crawford for about 40 years.She is soon to retire.When she first began she had no car or bicycle and had to walk.Sometimes she had to hitch hike on lorries to Abington.She was allowed to hire a car to go long distances.When she went to Camps she got a lift with the school car. Nowadays things are much better.
